tafseer.tafsir: When the polytheists of Mecca gathered at their meeting place which was near the Baitullah, they often discussed the condition of the Prophet Muhammad and the Al-Qur'an he had brought with him. They often asked one another whether Muhammad was a sorcerer, a poet, or a sorcerer who was corrupted by their idols? They also wonder whether the Qur'an is magic, poetry, or just incantations? Each of them expressed their opinion according to their desires and dreams, while the Prophet Muhammad himself calmly conveyed his appeal based on the verses of the Qur'an which give light to mankind towards the path of truth and straight guidance. In addition, they often talk about the day of resurrection, which often creates debate, because some of them deny it and think that after death their business will be finished. There is no more resurrection after death. They argue that humans are born into the world and then they die and are swallowed up by the earth because nothing destroys them except time or time. On the other hand, there are also those who think that it is only the spirits that are resurrected and not the bodies that have been eaten up by the earth. There were also those who met one of the Prophet's companions and asked about it in a scornful manner. In connection with their attitude like that, this surahh came down to refute their denial, and put forward a real argument that Allah is truly Almighty to raise them back after death, even though they had become soil, eaten by wild beasts, swallowed by fish in the sea, burned by fire. and blown away by the wind, or other reasons. In this verse, Allah denounces the dispute among the disbelievers of Mecca regarding the day of resurrection by saying, "About what do the polytheists among the inhabitants of Mecca question each other?" God answered their questions with His word. What is meant by very big news in this verse is news about the Day of Judgment. It is called a very big news because the Day of Judgment will be very riotous as mentioned in the word of Allah: O people! Fear your Lord; indeed, the shock (day) of Doomsday is a very big (event). (Remember) on the day when you see it (the shaking), all women who breastfeed their children will be neglectful of the child they are nursing, and every woman who is pregnant will have a miscarriage, and you will see people in a drunken state, even though they are not drunk, but doom God is very harsh. (al-hajj/22: 1-2) Even so, polytheists still doubt and even many do not believe, as Allah explains in His word: (Life) is nothing but our life in this world, (there ) we died and lived and will not be resurrected (again). (al-Mu'minun/23: 37) Allah's Word: We do not know what the Day of Judgment is, we are just guessing, and we are not sure. (al-Jatsiyah/45: 32) As for Divine wisdom in conveying this issue in the form of questions and answers, this is to bring it closer to understanding and explanation, as contained in the word of Allah: (Then Allah said), "To whom does the kingdom today belong?" Belongs to Allah, the One and Only, the All-Conquering. (Gafir/40: 16) Then Allah answered their question in a threatening tone, "Absolutely not. Far from the truth of what they think is. Later they will find out when they witness the actual situation on the Day of Judgment which they always deny. " It is better for them not to make fun of it because they will know the truth later. Anything that is doubtful they will surely experience. God strengthens His word by repeating the statement one more time. Then Allah explained His almighty power and the signs of His mercy which were often forgotten by them. Yet the signs were clearly visible before the eyes. Allah put forward nine things that they could see with their eyes as evidence showing His power, as mentioned in the following verses, namely from verse 6 to verse 14.

First, didn't Allah make the earth as an expanse that is easily inhabited by humans and livestock that are useful for humans. Actually the earth is round like a ball, but because it is so big, its surface looks flat like an expanse.
Second, Allah made the mountains as pegs to fix the earth, so that it does not shake because of the shocks beneath it.

Third, what is no less great is that Allah created humans in pairs, male and female, so that love and affection would arise between husband and wife to lead a happy life and maintain good offspring, to maintain the continuation of the human race so that it does not become extinct. This verse is in line with the intention of Allah's word: And among His signs (greatness) is that He creates partners for you from your own kind, so that you are inclined and feel at ease towards him, and He created between you feelings of love and affection. (ar-Rum/30: 21)

Fourth, Allah made sleeping at night to rest from busy work during the day, in order to produce various livelihoods. By resting during sleep, humans can restore power and strength to carry out work the next day. If it is not accompanied by restful sleep, of course, anyone's strength will decrease so that they cannot carry out their daily tasks.

Fifth, Allah made the night as clothing. It means that the night is dark covering the surface of the earth as clothes cover the human body. This means that the night serves as a garment for humans that can cover their private parts during sleep from the sight of people who might see them. Likewise as clothing, the darkness of the night can protect and hide someone who sleeps from danger or threatening enemies.
Sixth, Allah made the day to try and seek the sustenance needed in life and to live in society.

Seventh, God builds seven firm heavens above mankind without pillars and submits to God's law. Scientifically, the seven solid heavens can possibly be interpreted by the layers of the atmosphere close to this earth, such as: (1) Troposphere (Troposphere), (2) Tropopause (Tropopaus), (3) Stratosphere (Stratosphere), (4) Stratopause (Stratopaus), (5) Mesosphere (Mesosphere), (6) Mesopause (Mesopause), and (7) Thermosphere (Thermosphere). This division is based on the temperature (temperature) of the layers of the atmosphere and their distance from the earth's surface. The robustness of these layers, in the sense of being sturdy in enveloping our globe, is due to the earth's gravitational force. (See also scientific studies in surahh ar-Ra'd/13:2, Juz-13). In the scientific study of surahh ar-Ra'd/13: 2, the division of the layers of the atmosphere is slightly different from that described in this scientific study, where the ionosphere and exosphere are united in the thermosphere. However, if the understanding of the seven heavens is associated with the Ascension of the Prophet Muhammad, it seems inappropriate. The seven skies in surahh an-Naba'/78: 12 may be interpreted as the Seven Dimensions of Space-Time in the Kaluza-Klein Theory (KKT). As stated in physics, there are four (4) Fundamental Forces in this universe, namely the Electromagnetic Force, the Weak Nuclear Force, the Strong Nuclear Force, and the Gravitational Force. If these four forces were formed from the Big Bang of a Singularity, then these four forces must have previously 'unified as One Single Force (Grand Unified Force), this is what is known in the Grand Unified Theory (GUT, Theory of Great Unity?). KKT explains that in order to be able to explain the unity of the four forces, the existence of the space-time geometry that we are in today is not enough. The geometry of space-time that we live in today can only say so much about Electromagnetic forces and in some cases Gravitational Forces. In order to be able to explain these four styles, the KKT stated that there must be seven other time-space dimensions. Thus with the four dimensions that are already known, namely: line, plane, space and time; then the total dimensions are eleven (11) dimensions. This statement is based on Mathematical-Physical calculations. Based on this KKT, scientists have also been able to calculate the 'diameter of one of the space-time dimensions, which is 10-32 cm, so that dimension is very small. Thus, it is impossible with the instruments that exist today that we can penetrate the other seven dimensions of space-time. The Kaluza-Klein Theory has provided a description of the existence of Seven Space-Time Dimensions, all of which will establish the geometry of the universe with its four fundamental forces. Could it be that the seven firm heavens are the seven dimensions of space-time according to the Kaluza-Klein Theory? Wallahu a'lam bis-sawab.

Eighth, Allah made the sun a bright lamp, spreading its light and heat throughout the sky. Allah has made the sun whose rays contain medicine to kill germs and drive away diseases that can plague living things if they don't get enough light.

Ninth, Allah sends down rainwater that is abundant and beneficial, especially for growing plants that are useful for humans and animals. It aims to be able to grow grains such as wheat, vegetables, rice, and plants for food for humans and livestock. So are gardens and parks that are dense with their lush leaves. In this verse, Allah mentions various kinds of plants that grow on earth, some of which have stems and some do not. Some produce fruit and some produce grains such as wheat, rice, and others for human food. There are also plants for animal feed. All of these are staple foods and supplements for humans.

In this verse, Allah explains that the day of resurrection must occur at a predetermined time. On that day it will be decided what punishment the disbelievers will receive in hell and the rewards that the believers will receive in heaven, both past, present and future. There, their destiny and life will be very different according to the degree of their deeds while in the world. Allah has made that day the boundary between the world and the hereafter, where all creatures will gather at Padang Mahsyar so that each one can see and witness what they have done while living in the world, so that those who do good will receive their reward and those who do evil will receive punishment. Then Allah explained the signs of that day and their awesomeness with His words in the following verses.

On the Day of Judgment, the second trumpet is blown by the angel Israfil which causes all creatures to be resurrected, rise from their respective graves and gather in Padang Mahsyar. Each community is led by its apostle, so they come in groups as in the word of God. (Remember), on the day (when) We call every nation with its leader. (al-Isra'/17: 71)

In this verse, Allah explains that on the day of judgment the heavens are opened and have doors that separate one part from another. It means that the sky is split into two so that it has gaps as if it were open and has doors. This is explained by another word of God: When the heavens split open. (al-Insyiqaq/84: 1) This happens because there has been a major change in the arrangement of the planets in the universe, which has caused a change in their attractions and orbits. That incident led to the destruction of the universe, and also the destruction of the world's natural world.

In this verse, it is explained that on that day the mountains will no longer be as they were before, but will be shaken so that they crumble like mist which from afar looks like the shadow of water. However, when approached, it turns out there is nothing because the pieces have been broken, destroyed, and flying everywhere. God's Word in this regard: And the earth and the mountains were lifted up, then they collided with one blow. (al-haqqah/69: 14) Then in another verse Allah says: And the mountains are crushed to pieces, so they become dust flying. (al-Waqi'ah/56: 5-6) Then the mountains will be crushed like dust flying as described in the word of Allah: And the mountains are like fluff. (al-Qari'ah/101: 5) Verses 17-20 of surahh an-Naba'/78 above seem to speak of the doomsday. In the verse discussed, there is a description of the trumpet blowing. There are other verses that also use the word trumpet or trumpet in describing the apocalypse, such as surahh an-Nazi'at/79: 6-9, "(Indeed, you will be resurrected) on the day when the first blast shakes nature, (the first blast) is accompanied by with the second blast. The human heart at that time was very afraid, his eyes were submissive." The four verses above discuss what will happen when the Day of Judgment occurs. One of the events that day was a very powerful earthquake. In verses 6-9 of surahh an-Nazi'at/79, an earthquake event, possibly an earthquake, is described by the word "blowing". If we look at verses 6 and 7 of surahh an-Nazi'at/79 above, it appears that there is a similarity in the description of the Day of Judgment. However, there are two opinions regarding its depiction. On the one hand, the scholars interpret the word ar-rajifah as the sound of the first trumpet, and ar-radifah as the sound of the second trumpet. On the other hand, ar-rajifah is declared as the earth, and ar-radifah as the time of the trial. There are also those who interpret ar-rajifah as the chaos of the elements of the earth, while ar-radifah is the earthquake. It seems the latter opinion is more realistic. There is no difference between the chaos of the earth's elements and an earthquake. However, there seems to be another opinion that makes more sense. Perhaps the two words that many scholars try to interpret actually indicate a main earthquake and aftershocks, as can be seen in the translation and tafsir of verses 6 and 7 of surahh an-Nazi'at/79 in Tafsir Al-Misbah, "On the day when the earthquake shook terrible, followed by those who accompany (him)." Before the main earthquake (main shock), several small earthquakes (fore shock) will start. After the main earthquake occurs, it is followed by aftershocks which are smaller in strength and numerous in number. Gradually these aftershocks decreased both in number and strength. Please note that the initial earthquake is difficult to identify. Usually the main earthquake comes immediately, and destroys everything without showing any initial earthquake. As an illustration, the Aceh earthquake that occurred on December 26, 2004 with a magnitude of Mw=9.3 came without an initial earthquake. The earthquake that broke the seabed along nearly 1000 km caused a tsunami and destroyed the area around the Indian Ocean. The Aceh earthquake then triggered the Nias earthquake with a very large strength, namely Mw = 8.7. So, in essence the Nias earthquake was not an aftershock but an earthquake that was triggered by the first big earthquake. Both the Aceh and Nias earthquakes were followed by their respective aftershocks. With this description, the earthquakes that will come on the Day of Judgment will be far more devastating and capable of triggering earthquakes that are just as devastating so that the earth is devastated.

In fact, the place where Allah's punishment will be carried out is the Hellfire, which is always in a position to wait for the infidels to be tortured in it. Narrated by Ibn Jarir and Ibn Mundhir from al-Hasan al-Basri, "No one enters paradise except after going through hell. If he has passed it, he will be safe and if not, he will be detained."
It is explained here that Hell is a place of return for those who are disobedient and transgressive, who do not want to listen to the invitation of the apostles who bring guidance and truth.
They stay in hell for a long time as also explained in God's word: They want to get out of hell, but will not be able to get out of there. And they will get eternal punishment. (al-Ma'idah/5: 37)
In Hellfire they do not feel the coolness that can reduce the scorching heat, nor do they get a drink that can quench their thirst.
Apart from the boiling water that reached the peak of the heat, there was also pus that was very foul-smelling.

Hell Hell is provided as a reward from God that is commensurahte with the sins and transgressions that they commit in the world, because every evil and bad will be rewarded with the appropriate evil and badness. The appropriate punishment was given because of the very serious sin they had committed, namely associating partners with Allah. They burn in Hell for a very long time.

After explaining the outline of the punishment of hell in the previous verses, in the following verses Allah mentions the details of that sin, which is divided into two parts: first, they are not afraid of the day of reckoning because they deny its coming. Therefore, they are not afraid to commit these violations according to the invitation of their lust. Second, they deny Allah's verses and what is stated in the Qur'an about the obligation to obey Allah in accordance with the call of the apostles and believe in the day of resurrection.

After explaining the outline of the punishment of hell in the previous verses, in the following verses Allah mentions the details of that sin, which is divided into two parts: first, they are not afraid of the day of reckoning because they deny its coming. Therefore, they are not afraid to commit these violations according to the invitation of their lust. Second, they deny Allah's verses and what is stated in the Qur'an about the obligation to obey Allah in accordance with the call of the apostles and believe in the day of resurrection.

After explaining their bad deeds and misguided beliefs, Allah in this verse explains that everything they do has been calculated according to the records that are with Him. All human practices as a whole have been recorded in His records, nothing is left out in the slightest.
In this verse, Allah explains that as a result of disbelief and disobedience, they will feel His torment. Allah will not increase except with a more painful punishment.
In this verse, Allah explains that those who are pious will truly get victory and happiness with great honor and reward in heaven.
In it there are various favors, among others, in the form of date palm gardens and grapes which are very delicious, according to taste, and pleasing to the eye.

Then it was also explained that in heaven there are also many beautiful, plump, and age-old angels. The pleasure of associating with women, which is usually the highest pleasure in the world, will also be experienced by the heavenly experts in a more perfect way, but one cannot imagine how it will happen later.
In it there are also dishes of drinks packed in full glasses. In another word of God it is stated: And there they were given a glass of ginger-mixed drink. (al-Insan/76: 17)

In that heaven, they will not hear words that are meaningless or vain and not words that are lying even though they drink wine, as explained in the word of Allah: (In that heaven) they stretch out glasses whose contents do not (generate) words useless or sinful. (ath-thur/52: 23)
In this verse it is explained that great victory and happiness are many gifts from Allah, as His grace and gifts to servants who obey Him.

In this verse, Allah explains that He is the Lord Who takes care of the heavens and the earth and everything in between with His nature as the Most Gracious God. Allah's majesty on the Day of Judgment is very visible, no one will talk to Allah, except with His permission.

In this verse, Allah explains that on the Day of Judgment the Angel Gabriel and the other angels will stand in rows waiting for Allah's command. They said nothing except after being given permission by Allah, Most Gracious. Even the words they spoke at that time were only true words.

In this verse, Allah explains that the Day of Judgment will definitely occur and issues that were previously closed or hidden will surely be revealed. Likewise, what is stored in the human heart, on that day will surely be shown. Therefore, Allah encourages them to draw closer to Him and do things that distance themselves from His punishment. Thus, he will definitely walk the path back to his Lord with great happiness.

This verse warns the disbelievers that Allah has warned them with an imminent torment. Everyone must understand that whatever is about to happen is near the time of its occurrence. The matter of the time gap is not an important thing, but what is important is that the event will surely be experienced by him. So a reasonable person always prepares for the events that will meet him. On that day, man will see what his hands have done, as also explained in the word of Allah: (Remember) on the day (when) every soul gets (return) for the good that has been done before it, (so does the reward) for the crimes he has committed. He wished that there was a long distance between him and that (day). (Ali 'Imran/3: 30) On that day, the disbelievers will say with sadness and regret, "I wish I were only soil in the world, and not a human being who is disobedient to God."
